Posidonius of Apameia, from Crabbes Historical Dictionary, published in 1825

KW360001 Posidonius of Apameia, from Crabbes Historical Dictionary, published in 1825 (litho) by English School, (19th century); Private Collection; (add.info.: Posidonius of Apameia (c.135-51 BC), also known as Posidonius of Rhodes; Greek Stoic philosopher, politician, astronomer, geographer, historian and teacher; ); Ken Welsh; English, out of copyright. Intellectual

Framed Prints

Discover the rich historical depth of this exquisite Framed Print featuring Posidonius of Apameia from the Crabbes Historical Dictionary, published in 1825. This beautiful lithograph, created by the English School in the 19th century, showcases Posidonius, a renowned ancient philosopher and historian from Apameia in Syria. His wisdom and knowledge during the Hellenistic period continue to fascinate scholars and history enthusiasts alike. With its intricate details and stunning preservation, this Framed Print is not only a captivating addition to your home or office decor, but also a testament to the enduring allure of fine art and historical knowledge.

Discover the captivating historical figure of Posidonius of Apameia with this exquisite fine art print from Media Storehouse. Originating from the Crabbes Historical Dictionary, published in 1825, this 19th-century lithograph by the English School provides an intriguing glimpse into the past. Posidonius of Apameia (c.135-51 BC), a renowned ancient Greek philosopher and historian, comes to life in this detailed and beautifully preserved image. Bring history into your home or office and elevate your decor with this stunning piece of historical art. Order your Media Storehouse Photographic Print of Posidonius of Apameia today and immerse yourself in the rich tapestry of history.

Jigsaw Puzzles

Discover the captivating world of ancient history with Media Storehouse's exquisite jigsaw puzzles. Our latest addition brings you closer to the enigmatic philosopher and geographer, Posidonius of Apameia. This intriguing puzzle, featuring an image from the 1825 Crabbes Historical Dictionary published by Bridgeman Images, invites you to piece together the likeness of this influential figure from the ancient world. Immerse yourself in the rich details of the 19th-century lithograph, bringing history to life in your own home. Perfect for history enthusiasts, puzzle collectors, or anyone seeking a challenging and rewarding pastime.
